-e ---

𒀳 ≈ 𒐀𒐺𒁹 ≈ 𒐁·𒋰𒁹 𒀳 ≈ 𒌋𒁕 ≠ 𒌋 𒂆 𒀳 ≈ 𓍁 =>

𒀳 ᴴAPIN 𓉔 𓃀 𓈖 𓍁 heben hebeln

𒀳 ᴴAPIN < 𒀳 absin₃ 𒀊𒉆 ab-sin₂ #abšinnu "furrow" 𒆠𒀸𒀸 … 𒀳 apın- @ Turk 𒄑𒀳 apıncı "(seed) plow" <> apınmak 𒀳 𒇲 apin-la₂ ≈ abyar آبیار "planter, tiller "

𒀳 ≈ 𓍁 APIN ≈ 𓌹 + 𓌞 pin 𓍄 ? 𒀳 ᶠURU: furrow, farmer ֆերմեր fermer ფერმერი permeri 𒀳 ᶠURU > ᶠULU فَلَّاح fallāḥ fellow farmer 𒀳 uru₄ 𒌾𒊒 uru₁₁ 𒄿𒊒 i-ru #erēšu ᶻuru זָרַע zará' زرع zaraʕ karen > colō "to sow; cultivate" 𒀳 ḥaraθ < Kar @ Acker
𒀳 ereš4 𒀳 earth worker 𒀳 erēšu [APIN (ENGAR)] ackern:
𒀳 APIN aPˡin plowⁿ in 𒀳𒇲 planter 𒀳 APIN a •plank <> brachio 𒁕 𒀉 𒀳𒍑 APIN.UŠ •plenus (an official)

𒀳 ᵐengar 𓏠 𓈖 𓃒 𓀸 mungar 𒈬𒌦𒃼 mu-un-gar₃ 𒈬𒌦𒂵𒅈 mu-un-ga-ar 농부 農夫 nonggar 农夫 nóngfūʳ "farmer" 𒀳 ᵐengar manguard man@acker #ikkaru Ackerer farmer

In Proto-Elamite and Proto-Cuneiform 𓌸 ploughs 𒀳 looked slightly similar to 𓍁, as did arrows 𒋾 (naturally)

𒀊𒉆 ab-sin2 ; absin 𒆠𒀸𒀸 ≈ absin3 𒀳 ; "furrow" #abšinnu; šeru

to sow, plant
to cultivate
to plough
to be tilled (field) ⲓⲉⲫⲟⲩⲱⲓ ⇔ ⲥⲉⲑⲓⲟϩⲓ
to be grown (plant)

𒀳 apin 𒄑𒀳 ĝeš apin "plow" #epinnu
𒀳 𒇲 apin-la2 "planter, tiller" #errēšu aratore
𒀳𒌆𒆥 apin-tug2-saga11 "type of plough"
𒀳 𒍑 APIN.UŠ "an official"

  1. month 𒌚 𒀳 Samnu Marduk - 𒀭𒀫𒌓 Zuqaqīpu (Scorpio) - 𒀯𒄈𒋰 Cheshvan מַרְחֶשְׁוָן/חֶשְׁוָן Tishrīn ath-Thānī Oct/Nov

𒀳𒄖 pin-guᶥⁿ ;)
𒀳𒄖 a bird

𒀳;𒀊𒉆;𒆠𒀸𒀸 absin₃;ab-sin₂;absin absin furrow bordzăⁿ ab'šan шан şırım шияр šiyar sulco 𐎚𐎍𐎎 tlm תֶּלֶם‎ télem tilling sillon ակոս akosᵒⁿ 𒆠𒀸𒀸 خط‎ कुंड kuṇḍ ḵaṭ qırış Kante #abšinnu;šer'u
